intro: Arracacia chirripoi, commonly known as the Costa Rican arracacha, is a herbaceous plant native to Central America. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are tuberous and are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
